intro: Galeopsis gacognei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved horseweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, pale blue or purple flowers in whorled clusters. It is typically found in meadows, roadsides, and other disturbed habitats. Galeopsis gacognei is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
